description: Haven't spend so much time to trouble shoot any of the software i am using like crash plan. Every time i check and its not working. Risky software because you think you have backup but in reality you don't.
One of the best backup solutions available.
I could not install as I got an error suggested repository was not found even when connected to IBM SAS VPN.
I personally use this tool to backup data when I need to upgrade my OS. I always recovered my files easily after that.

since a the last update I face the following issue that the app needs to be removed and installed again so that I can do a backup. after a while the application also dis-appears again.

my suspicion is that the auto update is doing something bad...
summary: having a hard time with this app

description: Don't lose time on this! Support is sub-zero!
summary: Never works when I need it! Support non-existing!

description:
IBM's Code42 worked perfectly, it had a solid base configuration and you could tune that configuration to meet your particular needs like include files or folders, set a backup schedule...
Kyndryl's Code42 on the other hand has almost all important settings locked, which includes file selection and scheduling. That means you can't exclude garbage folders (like Trash and Cache/Temp) that are heavily modified, and you can't also set schedules, it's configured/forced to run all the time.
summary: Good app with bad configuration forced to it

description: I preferred when I could decide what I wanted to be backuped ... Don't understand why we can not change it anymore.

As someone menthined, it forced us to backup all files in PC and cannot select and skip needless files from backup. Therefore anytime it consumes tremendous time to finish backup once it start. Worst is, if you shutdown your PC during backing up a big file such as windows virtual machin image file(over 50GB) , backup will start from the beginning after next boot. So it would never finished.

I have use use Terminal "yum clean all" and "yum update" to get CrashPlan patching to work... also have to uninstall / install CrashPlan periodically when patching won't work. Tool works but is very tedious to support and use?!?!?! Is there nothing better?
